abstract: Greek authorities move over 2,000 migrants from makeshift camp in Idomeni, near Macedonian border, to state-run encampments near Thessaloniki; camp held thousands of migrants blocked from entering Europe after closing of crucial border crossing and has been shrinking over period of weeks at urging of authorities.

headline.print_headline: Greece Begins Moving Refugees Out of Camp Along ‘Balkan Trail’
headline.main: Greece Begins Moving Refugees Out of Idomeni Camp

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

snippet: About 8,000 migrants were living in squalid conditions in the encampment, hoping to be allowed to cross the border and head to Northern or Western Europe.
lead_paragraph: About 8,000 migrants were living in squalid conditions in the encampment, hoping to be allowed to cross the border and head to Northern or Western Europe.
